title: Simeone insists that Lucas Hernandez was Atletico Madrid's biggest loss - NOT Griezmann
text:
Diego Simeone has admitted that he thinks Atletico Madrid's biggest loss in the summer transfer window was Lucas Hernandez - and NOT Antoine Griezmann.

The French pair both headed away from Madrid, to Bayern Munich and Barcelona respectively, but while it was Griezmann that commanded the huge transfer fee, Simone believes Hernandez is a bigger miss.

'The exit that hurt us the most was Lucas, who was a boy from the academy,' Simeone told Cadena Ser. '[It hurt] More than Griezmann.'

Antoine Griezmann was Atletico Madrid's most high-profile exit, costing a huge £107m

Lucas Hernandez, though, was a bigger loss for the club... according to boss Diego Simeone

Griezmann's elongated transfer saga finally ended with him securing a £107m move to the Nou Camp, while Hernandez cost Bayern a club-record £68m.

Despite believing that the latter was a bigger heartbreak, Simeone did only have good things to say about Griezmann, and has backed him to come good.

'I've spoken with him on occasion since he left,' Simeone revealed. 'He's where he wants to be. He's a humble boy who doesn't speak much, he's calm and cheerful.

'I've no doubt that he'll end up doing well there, but now everything depends on [Ernesto] Valverde, not me.'

Hernandez (left, with his girlfriend Amelia, appears to be loving life at Bayern Munich
